postcode.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a group of numbers and letters that you write at the end of an address on an envelope, package etc. The postcode shows the exact area where someone lives and helps the post office deliver the post more quickly
postcode.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a series of letters and numbers showing exactly where a building is. Postcodes are used so that post can be delivered more quickly. Insurance companies also use postcodes to calculate insurance rates in different areas
postcode.translation[1].definitions[0].e: A specialist agency will add postcodes to addresses where customer records are incomplete.
